009package imagingbook.pdf;
010
011import com.lowagie.text.DocumentException;
012import com.lowagie.text.pdf.BaseFont;
013import imagingbook.core.resource.NamedResource;
014
015import java.io.IOException;
016
017
018/**
019 * This enum type collects the set of 14 Type-1 standard fonts that every PS/PDF reader is supposed to have available by
020 * default. The associated resource directory contains both .AFM and .PFB files. iText/OpenPDF never embeds any of these
021 * fonts on the exported PDF, which may cause problems during pre-press checking, where generally ALL fonts should be
022 * embedded.
023 *
024 * @author WB
025 */
026public enum Type1CoreFont implements NamedResource {
027        Courier("Courier.afm"),
028        CourierBold("Courier-Bold.afm"),
029        CourierBoldOblique("Courier-BoldOblique.afm"),
030        CourierOblique("Courier-Oblique.afm"),  
031        Helvetica("Helvetica.afm"),
032        HelveticaBold("Helvetica-Bold.afm"),
033        HelveticaBoldOblique("Helvetica-BoldOblique.afm"),
034        HelveticaOblique("Helvetica-Oblique.afm"),      
035        TimesRoman("Times-Roman.afm"),
036        TimesBold("Times-Bold.afm"),
037        TimesBoldItalic("Times-BoldItalic.afm"),
038        TimesItalic("Times-Italic.afm"),        
039        Symbol("Symbol.afm"),
040        ZapfDingbats("ZapfDingbats.afm");
041        
042        private static final String BASEDIR = "fonts/type1";    
043        private final String filename;
044        private BaseFont basefont = null;               // cached singleton BaseFont instance
045
046        /**
047         * Constructor.
048         * @param filename the name of the font's AFM file
049         */
050        Type1CoreFont(String filename) {
051                this.filename = filename;
052        }
053        
054        @Override
055        public String getFileName() {
056                return filename;
057        }
058        
059        @Override
060        public String getRelativeDirectory() {
061                return BASEDIR;
062        }
063
064        /**
065         * Returns the {@link BaseFont} instance associated with this enum element. The font is created when this method is
066         * called the first time.
067         *
068         * @return the {@link BaseFont} instance associated with this font
069         */
070        public BaseFont getBaseFont() {
071                if (basefont == null) {
072                        try {
073                                String fontpath = getURL().toString();
074                                basefont = BaseFont.createFont(fontpath, "", BaseFont.EMBEDDED);
075                        } catch (DocumentException | IOException e) { 
076                                System.out.println("Trouble: " + e);
077                        }
078                }
079                return basefont;
080        }
081
082        // -----------------------------------------------
083        
084/*
085    public static void main(String[] args) {
086                System.out.println("Font resource is in JAR: " + Type1CoreFont.Courier.isInsideJar());
087                for (Type1CoreFont sf : Type1CoreFont.values()) {
088                        System.out.println(sf.toString() + ": " + sf.getBaseFont().getPostscriptFontName());
089                        System.out.println("   " + sf.getRelativePath());
090                        System.out.println("   " + sf.getStream());
091                        System.out.println("   " + sf.getURL());
092                        System.out.println("   " + sf.getBaseFont());
093
094                }
095        }
096*/
097
098}
